skill.name: datacommons-client
skill.description: Work with Data Commons, a platform providing programmatic access to public statistical data from global sources. Use this skill when working with demographic data, economic indicators, health statistics, environmental data, or any public datasets available through Data Commons. Applicable for querying population statistics, GDP figures, unemployment rates, disease prevalence, geographic entity resolution, and exploring relationships between statistical entities.
skill.summary: Work with Data Commons, a platform providing programmatic access to public statistical data from glo...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown documentation teaching how to use the official Data Commons Python API for accessing public statistical data. No network calls, file access, or code execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Query public statistics from Data Commons
content.value_statement: Accessing demographic, economic, and health data from multiple global sources requires navigating complex APIs. This skill provides complete guidance for using the Data Commons Python client to query population statistics, unemployment rates, GDP figures, and other public datasets through a unified knowledge graph.
actual_capabilities: Query statistical observations for population, income, unemployment, and health metrics
Resolve place names and coordinates to Data Commons identifiers (DCIDs)
Explore entity relationships and geographic hierarchies in the knowledge graph
Access time-series data for trend analysis with Pandas integration
Filter data by source and retrieve observations across multiple entities
Navigate place hierarchies from countries to counties and cities
limitations: Requires API key from datacommons.org for the default endpoint
Resolve API currently supports only place entities (countries, states, cities, counties)
Does not include raw data files; all data must be queried through the API

use_cases.title: Economic trend analysis
use_cases.description: Compare unemployment rates and income metrics across multiple states or countries over time

use_cases.title: Demographic research
use_cases.description: Access population statistics, age distributions, and health indicators for academic studies

use_cases.title: Regional statistics lookup
use_cases.description: Retrieve verified statistics for specific geographic regions to inform decisions

prompt_templates.title: Basic population query
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the latest population count for California and Texas using Data Commons

prompt_templates.title: Time series analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the unemployment rate time series for the United States from 2010 to 2023

prompt_templates.title: Geographic hierarchy
prompt_templates.prompt: Query median household income for all counties in Florida for the year 2020

prompt_templates.title: Multi-variable comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare population, median age, and unemployment rate for California, New York, and Texas

output_examples.input: Get the latest population for California and Texas

best_practices: Always resolve place names to DCIDs before querying to ensure accuracy
Use Pandas integration (to_observations_as_records) for data analysis
Filter by data source (filter_facet_domains) when consistency matters
anti_patterns: Hardcoding DCIDs without verifying they exist in the knowledge graph
Making individual queries for each entity when batch queries are more efficient
Ignoring data source provenance when combining data from multiple facets

faq.question: Does this skill work with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill supports Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The Data Commons Python client works in any Python environment.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for the Data Commons API?
faq.answer: Rate limits vary by API key tier. Free tier has lower limits; paid tiers offer higher throughput for production use.

faq.question: Can I combine Data Commons data with my own datasets?
faq.answer: Yes. Use coordinate or Wikidata ID resolution to map your data to DCIDs, then merge using Pandas DataFrames.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads public data. Your queries and API key stay local; only request data from datacommons.org.

faq.question: Why am I getting empty results for my query?
faq.answer: The entity or variable may not exist in Data Commons. Use fetch_available_statistical_variables to check available data.

faq.question: How does Data Commons differ from other data sources?
faq.answer: Data Commons normalizes data from multiple authoritative sources (census, WHO, World Bank) into a unified knowledge graph.
